title: Bad timing for an issue.
body: So a day before ranked resets and I still can't open league. Whenever I try to open with the .exe, using admin as well, it loads the initial logo with tthe bar beneath, instantly closes and then nothing appears afterwards. No process in task manager. I have tried re-installing, completely, several times, as well as into a different directory. I have allowed LoL through my anti-virus, tried the fix that involves deleting specific files, re-starting my computer after each new install and attempt and I have a stable internet connection the entire time. Nothing has worked. Please help. Computer runs on windows 7 by the way.

replies.body:
Dude that sucks, It sounds like a rouge process is constantly checking for League Of Legends and killing it when it loads into memory. Can you boot into safe mode / Check your startup applications and let me know whats running.

Cheers.

Yeah so turns out it was either a program called D3DGear or cyberlink video editor causing it to crash, still not entirely sure why. I suppose that's what i get for illegally obtaining these things, karma right? But yeah, managed to get it working once i deleted those. Thanks heaps for your help man, probably wouldn't have figured it out otherwise

Yeah so i tried that, everything is either related to running the system, or isn't affecting League. I tried stopping all the unnecessary processes and starting league after each, nothing worked. I'll post a patcher log, hopefully that'll help

I have reviewed the Patcher Logs you posted and they seem to be fine. The way I assume createProcess logging works is that the process is created with createWinProc() and then using a Win32API call checking whether the process is active. This means that something is terminating the process after its first cycle.

You have two options:
1) Although absolutly a last resort, reinstall windows from scratch (Complete Format)
2) Attach a process watcher to the process by PID and check its interactions within the Windows Messaging pipeline. Try and freeze the process on creation and capture its state.

tl;dr My inclinations are its not league of legends at all, Its something on your system terminating that process.

Do you have  Razer Synapt installed by any chance?

>reinstall windows

You must be joking. This is an issue with the way the program is written, not because someone has changed the settings from non-default. And the way Microsofts wants you to install Windows, you just should not do it. It formats your hard-drive, making you partition the drive or buy an expensive extrenal backup to keep your data (not to mention, you may not know what you need to keep, like config files).

This issue has happened to many people, and Riot needs to see to this. They didn't thoroughly test the new patcher, and that is their fault.
Sounds complicated. Is there any way of easily doing that? or at least a way of explaining it to someone who isn't the greatest with computers. No i don't have that installed.
